locutie.beschrijving: The sermon traces the theme of 'life out of death' through creation, the Exodus, Jeremiah's new covenant, and Jesus' metaphor of the grain of wheat.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Connects the 'Beth' acrostic of Psalm 119 and the socio-economic context of Deuteronomy/Babylon effectively.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the character of God through historical narrative, with a transition to inviting/commanding at the end.
voorbeelden: It is this God of the gospel who took primordial chaos in hand
God abruptly broke the despairing silence with a new declaration
Give it up. Lose that old life.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from despair/greed to a state of 'relinquishment' and 'glad obedience'.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of transformation.

voorbeelden: The God of the gospel brings life out of death.
It is no wonder that the church took up this oracle.
I will make a new covenant with you.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Moderate. The promises are quoted from the text (Jeremiah) rather than issued directly by the preacher to the congregation.

voorbeelden: This God makes a way out of no way!
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher describes God's declarations but rarely speaks as a mandatory of God to change the hearer's status now.

indicatoren: Extensive use of 'It is this God who...'
Historical recounting of Abraham, Sarah, and Egypt as facts rather than present encounters.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of God's past wonders rather than a participant in a present event.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise to the 'you' in the pews.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Mediated through the biblical characters; lacks direct 'I promise you on behalf of God'.
voorbeelden: You will be able to count on my promise.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Mostly 'we' (homiletic we) to group preacher and hearer.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address appears late, mostly in the Jeremiah quote and the final exhortation.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used in the quote of the promise, but not as the preacher's own performative act.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant. Talking about 'The God of the gospel', 'the church', 'the Israelites'.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General theological truths about God's character.

actueel_present.gebruik: Final call to relinquish old assumptions.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The transition from Section III to IV moves from describing the 'new life' (Assertive) to 'Give it up' (Directive) without a strong intervening Commissive/Declarative for the hearer.
voorbeelden: Resurrection life... is about resonance... Give it up.
foutief_patroon.probleem: Moralistic pressure without the 'gift' being handed over first.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon lacks a clear 'Because I now declare you forgiven, you can give it up' structure.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: We must die to many old assumptions... This God is ready to give new life.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a brilliant theological essay on the theme of newness, but it functions more as a description of God's resume than an encounter with His person.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The move from chaos to Abraham to Egypt to Babylon.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: It is this God of the gospel who...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Objectifies God as a subject of study.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It informs the mind about the possibility of an event, but the sermon itself does not 'happen' to the hearer as a new covenant moment.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher remains a narrator of God's acts rather than a mandatory of God's present word.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is a speaker in the past (Jeremiah), but the preacher does not position himself as God's current mouth.
tekstueel_bewijs: God abruptly broke the despairing silence with a new declaration

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon describes the means of grace but does not function as one.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Reduce 'is' and 'was'; increase 'I promise' and 'God says to you'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The God of the gospel brings life out of death.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, in this room, the God of the gospel is bringing life out of your death.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a present event.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is stuck in the 3rd person/past tense.
voorbeeldzinnen: Hear the word of the Lord: I forgive your iniquity, right here, right now.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the 'you' directly with the gospel indicative.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, who are weary of the imperial system, listen: God has a future for you.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The 'Give it up' feels like a heavy demand because the 'I give to you' wasn't performatively delivered.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ensure the Declarative (forgiveness) precedes the Directive (relinquishment).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The theological content is superb; shifting the illocutionary force from 'talking about' to 'addressing' will turn this lecture into a sacramental event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or 'appeal'; SAT reveals that the preacher is failing to use the 'Declarative' key which is unique to the office.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the repetition of 'It is this God' is powerful, but SAT shows it remains constative and thus keeps the hearer at a distance.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the 'crisis' of the sermon is not the content, but the lack of Commissive force (God binding Himself to the hearer today).

kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High, but would be higher if spoken as a direct address from the preacher.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on Brueggemann-esque rhetoric which is highly evocative but often remains in the realm of 'testifying about' rather than 'sacramental doing'.
